results.title: The Music album: Ethel Smith, Bette Black and the Henry King Orchestra
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: Four filmed performances: Henry King Orchestra - “Dos Grillitos”; Bette Black sings “Give Out” (accompanied by Henry King Orchestra); Ethel Smith plays on the organ “Paran pan pin - Cachita”; Henry King Orchestra - “El Cumbancheo”.

results.title: The Music album: continental melodies
results.brief_description: A selection of three song and dance performances: 1. “Sombrerita Mia” performed by Carmelita. 2. “Russian Revels” performed by The Lucky Girls. 3. “Brazil” performed by maria Del Ray and Raoul martinez and Milo Menendez and his Orchestra.

results.title: The Music album: 'Blue Danube' and 'Romance'
results.brief_description: An orchestra conducted by Frederick Feher plays Johann Strauss “Blue Danube” with singers Armanda Chinot and Christine McIntyre in first half, followed by a performance of “Romance” with singers Tandy McKenzie and Alice Avalsian.

results.title: The Muscle spindle
results.brief_description: This film shows how the electrical impulses produced by movement and tension of a muscle are transmitted to and received from the nervous system. The techniques for isolating a muscle spindle and keeping it alive outside the body are demonstrated.

results.title: The Movies: our modern art. The Lost world revisited
results.creator_credit: Dennis R. Atkinson, W. Gyorgy and Spectre Pictures
results.brief_description: A tribute to the Special Effects wizardry of Willis H O’Brien. A 1925 production of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s story is a classic of the silent era, and with King Kong, produced eight years later, O’Brien was proved a master of special effects. Analyses his artistic genius and contains a rare interview with O’Brien taken shortly before his death in 1962.
results.title_for_label: The Movies: our modern art. The Lost world revisited
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis R. Atkinson, W. Gyorgy and Spectre Pictures

results.title: The Movies story
results.creator_credit: Gerald A Schiller and SL Film Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the history of film from 1895 to 1915, beginning with Edison’s first experiments and concluding with Chaplin’s early shorts. Emphasises the contributions of Melies, Griffith and Chaplin. Narrated by William Wintersole.

results.title: The Movies go west
results.brief_description: A portrait of ‘Bronco Billy’ Anderson, the star of over 500 early Hollywood westerns. Narrated by one of Anderson’s co-stars, Hal Angus, and with the voice of Anderson himself.
